prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane 1. Draw a rectangle with the following dimensions: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.2679, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.2679, 0.0] to [0.2679, 0.0536] - Line 3: [0.2679, 0.0536] to [0.0536, 0.0536] - Line 4: [0.0536, 0.0536] to [0.0536, 0.2679] - Line 5: [0.0536, 0.2679] to [0.0, 0.2679] - Line 6: [0.0, 0.2679] to [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.2679. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Transform and rotate the scaled 2D sketch along the Z-axis using the given euler angles. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.75 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.2679 - Operation: Create a new body for the prism The final shape should be a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. The height, width, and length of this part are as follows: - Height: 0.2679 - Width: 0.75 - Length: 0.2679 Continue with the subsequent parts by repeating the above process using the JSON data for the respective parts. Use clear section breaks, headings, and `<part_num>` tags to distinguish between parts, and provide detailed step-by-step instructions for each part. Ensure to use simple and clear descriptions for the boolean operation of the current part with the previous body, as specified in the instructions.</description>
